RainbruRPG::Options::OptionFloatAttribute

RainbruRPG::Options::OptionFloatAttribute Class Reference

Collaboration diagram for RainbruRPG::Options::OptionFloatAttribute:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

An option storing a signed float value.

It is used with the OptionManager and may be added to an OptionButton.

Definition at line 45 of file optionfloatattribute.h.

void RainbruRPG::Options::OptionFloatAttribute::setStep ( float  f  )

void RainbruRPG::Options::OptionFloatAttribute::controlStep (  )  [protected]

Control if the step is a positive non-null value.

It sends a warning log message if the step is NULL (equal to 0)

Definition at line 106 of file optionfloatattribute.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Options::OptionAttribute::setType ( tOptionAttributeType  t  )  [inherited]

Set the type of the attribute.

Set OptionAttribute::type to t. If the type is OAT_UNKNOWN, a warning log message is sent to the Logger.

See also:
getType(), type.

t The new type of the attribute

void RainbruRPG::Options::OptionAttribute::setName ( const char *  n  )  [inherited]

Set the name of the attribute.

Logs a warning message if the name is empty. The control of the lenght of the string is done by std::strlen.

const char * RainbruRPG::Options::OptionAttribute::getToolTip (  )  [inherited]

Get the tooltip text of the attribute.

The name can contains space and other specials character but keep in mind this is used as the label of the option (in LauncherOptions dialog).

See also:

float RainbruRPG::Options::OptionFloatAttribute::step [protected]

The value for incrementing or decrementing value.

I cannot set a unsigned float so it is a float, but i must use abs to get only positive number.
